channel.title: Ocean Parkway Runs Red—And City Hall Looks Away on Crash Count
channel.description: Recent content in Ocean Parkway Runs Red—And City Hall Looks Away on Crash Count

item.title: Kalman Yeger resisted street safety reforms
item.description: Councilmember Kalman Yeger consistently opposed most citywide efforts to protect pedestrians and cyclists. He voted against speed cameras, daylighting, and Vision Zero street redesigns. While occasionally backing hyper-local fixes, his record favored drivers and framed safety reforms as overreach.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4801962 on 2025-03-29
item.description: Ocean Parkway near Quentin Road, Brooklyn — A sedan driven by an unlicensed woman ran the light. A mother and her three children were in the crosswalk. The signal was theirs. Three died. One, age four, lay crushed and still.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4797969 on 2025-03-11
item.description: Coney Island Ave near Avenue K — A southbound box truck struck a 44-year-old man crossing without a signal. He fell hard. Blood on the pavement. Head wounds. Deep cuts. The truck’s right bumper bore the mark. He did not wake.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4777578 on 2024-12-09
item.description: McDonald Ave near 1695 — A 2012 sedan turned left. The front end folded. A 27-year-old woman, unbelted in the passenger seat, struck her head. She stayed awake. Crush wounds spread. The air stank of alcohol.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4775450 on 2024-12-01
item.description: Corner of East 12th Street and Avenue L — A Jeep turned right. A 73-year-old woman crossed with the light. The front struck her head. No damage to the car. She died in the crosswalk, crushed where she stood.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4774039 on 2024-11-24
item.description: McDonald Ave near Bay Parkway, Brooklyn — A van veered, struck a station wagon. The SUV’s driver, 54, died belted in place. The airbag burst. His body broke inside. Two others rode in the van. The lane change was not safe.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4771373 on 2024-11-13
item.description: Ocean Parkway and Avenue P — Two sedans struck head-on. Steel folded. A man gripped his chest, breath shallow. A woman bled from the head, eyes open. Both belted. Both broken. The light faded, and the engines went still.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4769882 on 2024-11-07
item.description: 59th Street and 12th Avenue, Brooklyn — A Ford SUV struck a one-year-old boy. No crosswalk. No cry. He lay still on the pavement, head bloodied, body crushed. The bumper bore the mark. The street held its breath.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4759843 on 2024-09-28
item.description: Corner of Avenue L and Coney Island Avenue — A 50-year-old woman, crossing with the light, struck in the head by a turning SUV. She bled onto the pavement. The driver was licensed. The vehicle showed no damage.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4752262 on 2024-09-01
item.description: Avenue O near East 4th Street — A KIA turned left. An e-bike passed right. Metal met speed. A 21-year-old man flew, helmetless. His body hit pavement. Skin split. He stayed awake. He bled.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4733755 on 2024-06-17
item.description: Corner of 54th Street and 15th Avenue — A 67-year-old man crossed against the light. A southbound Dodge pickup struck him head-on. He died beneath its front end, his head broken, the truck’s lights shining down on stillness.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4717690 on 2024-04-16
item.description: Ocean Parkway and Avenue S — A 16-year-old boy on a bike struck a turning sedan. He flew forward, helmet cracked, face torn. He lay still on the asphalt, blood pooling, as morning drivers passed without slowing.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4711853 on 2024-03-23
item.description: 18th Avenue near 55th Street, Brooklyn — A moped slammed into the rear of a stopped SUV. The 22-year-old rider flew off, head first. No helmet. No chance. He died alone in the street before the sun rose.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4695874 on 2024-01-17
item.description: Avenue P — Two sedans collided at speed. The KIA struck left and low. A baby boy, not in the road, not in a car, bled from the head. He was conscious. The metal was twisted. The silence came after.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4692482 on 2024-01-03
item.description: Corner of 17th Avenue and 52nd Street — A Chevy SUV hit an 18-year-old woman crossing with the light. Blood streamed down her face. She stayed awake. The driver looked too late. The streetlights blinked. Traffic rolled on.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4692501 on 2024-01-03
item.description: Corner of 60th Street and 18th Avenue. A woman crossed with the light. An e-scooter came fast, struck her face. Blood spilled on the crosswalk. She stayed awake. The scooter crumpled. So did something else.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4685716 on 2023-12-07
item.description: Avenue F near McDonald Avenue, Brooklyn — A 12-year-old boy, crossing with the light, took an SUV’s front to the face. Blood pooled on cold asphalt. The driver stayed seated. The vehicle bore no mark. The boy stayed conscious.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4649253 on 2023-07-24
item.description: East 10th Street and Avenue O — A 71-year-old man crossed against the light. A Lexus reversed. Metal met bone. He lay semiconscious beneath the rear bumper. He died there, in the dark, under the car that backed into him.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4648149 on 2023-07-23
item.description: McDonald Avenue near Webster: A 68-year-old woman crossing the street was struck head-on by a southbound Lexus SUV. Her body broke beneath the front end. The driver was distracted. She died there. The street fell silent.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4642190 on 2023-07-02
item.description: Bay Parkway near McDonald Avenue — A man turned left on a TAIZH moped, distracted. He flew from the seat. Blood soaked his arm. Helmet on. Permit only. The front crumpled. He lay in shock, bleeding into the summer heat.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4641638 on 2023-06-27
item.description: Avenue M — A 77-year-old woman, crossing with the signal, was struck in the head by a turning Chevy sedan. She bled in the crosswalk. The car, undamaged. The driver, licensed. The light, green. The street, silent.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4618563 on 2023-04-05
item.description: Corner of 13th Avenue and 50th Street — A young man crossed. Two SUVs collided. One struck him. His body shattered under the weight. He died there, in the street, as headlights burned through the dusk.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4598382 on 2023-01-11
item.description: Corner of 17th Avenue and 59th Street — Two SUVs collided mid-afternoon. One ignored the light. Metal crumpled. A 28-year-old man drove. A 29-year-old sat beside him. Both conscious. Both bleeding. Lap belts held them while glass carved their skin.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4579733 on 2022-11-07
item.description: Fort Hamilton Parkway near 54th Street — A 23-year-old man on an e-bike, no helmet, struck by a sedan. Ejected. Head split. Blood on the asphalt. Unconscious. Dead before sunrise. Traffic control ignored.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4572961 on 2022-10-14
item.description: Avenue L near East 17th Street — A 49-year-old man on an e-scooter was struck head-on by a westbound Mercedes. The scooter was crushed. He wore no helmet. Speed and inexperience ended him. His body was thrown. He died there.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4561277 on 2022-09-06
item.description: Avenue P near 273rd—just past midnight. A taxi and a sedan met head-on in the dark. A woman in the back, belted and crushed. Her neck throbbed. The taxi driver had no license. Alcohol hung in the air.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4556993 on 2022-08-02
item.description: Near 1654 60th Street, Brooklyn — A Honda SUV backed into the night. The e-bike hit hard. A 33-year-old man clutched his bleeding arm. Flesh torn. Blood on the pavement. The SUV’s rear dented. The street held its breath.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4550242 on 2022-07-26
item.description: Bay Parkway, near Council District 44 — A 21-year-old e-bike rider, unlicensed and unhelmeted, was struck head-on by an unlicensed SUV. Thrown from the bike, he lay unconscious, bleeding from the head. Traffic control disregarded. No helmet. No chance.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4532525 on 2022-05-30
item.description: Avenue P and West 1st Street, Brooklyn — A 65-year-old man crossed with the light. A taxi struck him head-on. His pelvis shattered. He died where he fell. The SUV and parked cars bore the crash. The signal was ignored.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4522798 on 2022-04-15
item.description: Corner of 13th Avenue and 51st Street — A Volvo turned right. A woman crossed against the light. The SUV did not stop. Her arm was torn off. She died there, though her body still moved.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4501631 on 2022-02-09
item.description: East 12th Street—A 2012 BMW turned right. Its front bumper struck a five-year-old boy standing off the road. His small body broke beneath the metal. He never woke. The driver stayed licensed. The boy stayed dead.

item.title: Council District 44 — Crash 4497835 on 2022-01-27
item.description: Coney Island Avenue near 1358 — A 13-year-old girl crossed against the light. A southbound box truck struck her. She fell, bleeding from the head. Unconscious on the pavement. The truck bore no damage. The girl did not move.
